QuestionStem: Sundews have weakly developed roots. Why do you think sundews do not need strong roots?

options.AnswerText: A. Sundews do not need water or nutrients.
C. The soil contains few nutrients to absorb.
D. Sundews receive large amounts of sunlight.

CorrectFeedback: Since there is plenty of water in the soil, a weak root system can provide enough water to the plant. The soil is low in nutrients, and the plant is able to get nutrients from insects, so a strong root system is not necessary for the plant to survive.
PartiallyCorrectFeedback: Review the role of the root system.
IncorrectFeedback: Review the role of the root system.
FinalIncorrectFeedback: Since there is plenty of water in the soil, a weak root system can provide enough water to the plant. The soil is low in nutrients, and the plant is able to get nutrients from insects, so a strong root system is not necessary for the plant to survive.
